// comment: Need to split this file to describe creation of named-explicit-paths and tunnels with different operations:

One POST/PUT operation, rooted on named-explicit-path/odu2-service-named-explicit-path, to create/update the ODU2 service named explicit path and one POST/PUSH operation, rooted on tunnels/tunnel/odu2-service, to create/update the ODU2 service tunnel
Reason: doing this in one request would have some issues when a new Tunnel is created but there are already existing named-explicit-paths  and/or tunnels

config.name: odu2-service
// type: It seems this attribute will be removed in the next version of the TE Tunnel model
No longer needed since p2p and p2mp Tunnels have been split
config.description: Tunnel Segment supporting the ODU2 Transit Service in Use Case 1
config.// encoding and switching-type: Indicates this is an ODU Tunnel
config.// preference: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// reoptimize-timer: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// topology-id: ODU It seems not relevant forAbstract Topology @ MPI
config.// ignore-overload: To be analyzed in a future update
// bandwidth-generic: To be discussed with TE Tunnel model authors
The definition of ietf-te-types:te-bandwidth is a string with complex structure/parsing
Using the new ietf-te-types:te-bandwidth grouping seems simpler to indicate this is an ODU2 Tunnel
config.// disjointness: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// setup-priority: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// hold-priority: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// signaling-type: To be discussed with TE Tunnel model authors: syntax not complete and it seems not applicable to the MPI
config.// bidirectional: Indicates this is a bidirectional co-routed Tunnel

// provisioing: the MPI (to be further discussed with TE Tunnel model authors)

config.// ietf-otn-tunnel:payload-treatment: switching or transport? (to be further discussed by the DT)
config.// ietf-otn-tunnel:src-tpn: Is it needed? (to be further discussed by the DT)

config.name: odu2-service-explicit-path
config.// preference: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// path-setup-protocol: It seems not relevant for the MPI (to be further discussed by the DT)
config.// path-computation-method: To be reviewed by the DT
config.// path-computation-server: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// use-path-computation: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// verbatim: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// lockdown: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// named-path-constraint: To be analyzed in a future update
